channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Supreme Court appears to side with parents in religious liberty dispute over storybooks

item.title: House Republican enters race for Mitch McConnell's Senate seat, setting up high-stakes GOP primary
item.description: Rep. Andy Barr is jumping into the race to replace retiring Sen. Mitch McConnell in the November 2026 elections.

item.title: EPA chief Zeldin launches talks with Mexico to end sewage hitting San Diego, Navy SEALs: 'out of patience'

item.title: Trump's ban on transgender troops headed to the Supreme Court
item.description: The administration will ask the Supreme Court to revive President Trump's policy excluding openly transgender troops from serving in the military, a J...

item.title: We Need a New and Improved Environmentalism
item.description: This Earth Day, let’s commit to an environmentalism that works for America, not against it.

item.title: White House claims 'a lot of progress' on trade as IMF cuts growth forecast
item.description: The White House on Tuesday said it's making "a lot of progress" in reducing trade barriers through bilateral deals with nations, pointing to over a do...

item.title: ‘Fact-Checking’ Was Always Just Censorship. Polls Show Americans Could See Through It
item.description: Americans understand the goal of 'fact-checking' — not objective truth, but spreading left-wing propaganda and silencing dissent.

item.title: Trump to speak at Alabama, West Point commencements
item.description: President Trump said he'll give commencement addresses for the University of Alabama and the U.S. Military Academy at West Point, New York.

item.title: It’s Time to Hold International Organizations Accountable for Supporting Terrorism
item.description: Sovereign countries can be sued for providing such aid. Institutions such as UNRWA should be no different.

item.description: A D.C.-based appellate panel questioned the Trump administration's transgender military ban policy and a lower court's finding of animus behind the ba...

item.title: Trump’s War on the Fed
item.description: Politician-driven monetary policy has a long record of failure.

item.title: Expensive WI Supreme Court Seat Already Paying Off For Wealthy Leftist Donors
item.description: The cemented left-led court has upheld Democrat Gov. Tony Evers’ veto trick to increase public school funding for the next four centuries.

item.title: Abrego Garcia Gamed the System
item.description: He shouldn’t be in a prison in El Salvador, but he also never should have escaped deportation for so long.

item.title: Justices grill Maryland county on parent opt-out options for LGBTQ story time
item.description: The Supreme Court appeared skeptical Tuesday of a Maryland county school system's decision not to let parents opt their elementary-age children out of...

item.title: Trump backs Republican rivals in Arizona governor's race after Rep. Biggs enters contest: 'I had a problem'
item.description: Two Republican candidates in the 2026 Arizona governor's race have both been endorsed by President Donald Trump, he announced on Monday.

item.title: The Courts Are The Scofflaws Behind Our Current Constitutional Crisis
item.description: The Supreme Court’s double standard suggests it is not prudence dictating the outcome. It is also not the Constitution.

item.title: Judicial Supremacy Is A Poison Destroying America’s Constitutional Order
item.description: The Constitution gives the authority to execute the nation's laws to the president — not to the judiciary.

item.title: Trump to make two-day trip to Rome for funeral of Pope Francis
item.description: President Trump will depart Washington on Friday morning to attend Pope Francis' funeral in Rome over the weekend, the White House confirmed Tuesday.

item.title: Let Parents Protect Their Kids from Gender Ideology in Public Schools
item.description: The Supreme Court should affirm the right of parents in Montgomery County, Md., to opt out of radical teaching on gender.
